prompts.original_prompt: Keep my Calendar up to date by committing to only meetings that are part of my priorities.

claude_gutts.name: Priority Definition & Extraction
claude_gutts.capability: Identify and structure user's priorities from context, goals, and stated objectives
claude_gutts.user_goal: System understands what matters to the user for decision-making
claude_gutts.evidence: Would extract priorities from user profile, past decisions, or explicit statements

claude_gutts.name: Calendar Event Retrieval
claude_gutts.capability: Access and load pending calendar invitations and scheduled meetings requiring decisions
claude_gutts.user_goal: Get all meetings that need accept/decline decisions
claude_gutts.evidence: Calendar API query for events with pending RSVP status

claude_gutts.name: Meeting-Priority Alignment Scoring
claude_gutts.capability: Evaluate how well each meeting aligns with stated priorities using semantic matching and relevance scoring
claude_gutts.user_goal: Know which meetings support goals and which don't
claude_gutts.evidence: Scoring algorithm comparing meeting attributes to priority rules

claude_gutts.name: Accept/Decline Decision Logic
claude_gutts.capability: Determine which meetings to accept vs decline based on priority alignment thresholds and constraints
claude_gutts.user_goal: Automated keep/decline recommendations aligned with priorities
claude_gutts.evidence: Decision rules applied to alignment scores to generate accept/decline actions

claude_gutts.name: Calendar Action Execution
claude_gutts.capability: Execute accept/decline actions on calendar system by updating RSVP status
claude_gutts.user_goal: Calendar automatically reflects priority-based decisions
claude_gutts.evidence: Calendar API calls to update meeting RSVP responses

claude_gutts.name: Decision Justification & Reporting
claude_gutts.capability: Explain why each meeting was accepted or declined with explicit linkage to priority rules
claude_gutts.user_goal: Understand the reasoning behind each calendar decision
claude_gutts.evidence: Generated explanations linking decisions to specific priorities and alignment scores

gpt5_gutts.name: Retrieve Calendar Events
gpt5_gutts.capability: Access and fetch all scheduled calendar events from the user's calendar system
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure the system has the latest view of all meetings and events
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Implementation uses Google Calendar API to pull events with OAuth authentication

gpt5_gutts.name: Extract Event Attributes
gpt5_gutts.capability: Parse each event to extract key details such as title, time, participants, and description
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Enable downstream analysis of meeting relevance and priority
gpt5_gutts.evidence: JSON response from calendar API is parsed to extract event metadata fields

gpt5_gutts.name: Retrieve User Priority Profile
gpt5_gutts.capability: Access and load the user's defined priorities or priority model
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Provide a reference for determining which meetings align with user priorities
gpt5_gutts.evidence: System queries user preference store to retrieve priority categories and rules

gpt5_gutts.name: Classify Event Against Priorities
gpt5_gutts.capability: Determine if each event aligns with the user's stated priorities
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Identify which meetings should be committed to based on user priorities
gpt5_gutts.evidence: NLP model scores event description against priority keywords and returns binary relevance

gpt5_gutts.name: Filter Non-Priority Events
gpt5_gutts.capability: Separate events that do not match the user's priorities from those that do
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure only relevant meetings are considered for commitment
gpt5_gutts.evidence: System applies boolean filter to event list based on classification results

gpt5_gutts.name: Commit Priority Meetings
gpt5_gutts.capability: Update the calendar to confirm attendance for meetings identified as priority
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Keep the calendar accurate by committing to relevant meetings
gpt5_gutts.evidence: API call updates event RSVP status to 'accepted' for priority meetings

prompts.prompt_desc: Track important meetings, flag prep needs
prompts.original_prompt: Track all my important meetings and flag any that require focus time to prepare for them.

claude_gutts.name: Calendar Data Retrieval
claude_gutts.capability: Load and parse calendar events from data source for analysis
claude_gutts.user_goal: Get comprehensive calendar data for analysis
claude_gutts.evidence: Calendar API query loaded 267 events from my_calendar_events_complete_attendees.json

claude_gutts.name: Meeting Importance Classification
claude_gutts.capability: Score meetings based on multiple importance criteria (executives, customers, large meetings, presentations)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Identify which meetings are important and require attention
claude_gutts.evidence: Implemented importance scoring with 9 factors: executive_attendee (25pts), external_attendee (20pts), large_meeting (15pts), etc.

claude_gutts.name: Preparation Time Estimation
claude_gutts.capability: Calculate required preparation time based on meeting type, importance, and complexity
claude_gutts.user_goal: Know how much time to allocate for meeting preparation
claude_gutts.evidence: Created prep time mapping for 10+ meeting types: Executive Briefing (120min), Customer Meeting (90min), Technical Design Review (60min), etc.

claude_gutts.name: Meeting Flagging Logic
claude_gutts.capability: Identify and flag meetings that need preparation focus time based on importance and prep requirements
claude_gutts.user_goal: Get clear list of meetings requiring prep time allocation
claude_gutts.evidence: Flagging logic: importance_score >= 30 AND prep_time > 0 (identified 8 meetings requiring prep)

claude_gutts.name: Calendar Gap Analysis
claude_gutts.capability: Identify available time slots in calendar for scheduling focus time blocks
claude_gutts.user_goal: Find when focus time can be scheduled without conflicts
claude_gutts.evidence: Gap finding algorithm analyzes calendar: before first meeting, between meetings, after last meeting

claude_gutts.name: Focus Time Block Scheduling
claude_gutts.capability: Create and schedule preparation time blocks in calendar with appropriate timing
claude_gutts.user_goal: Automatically block time for meeting preparation
claude_gutts.evidence: Scheduled 6 focus time blocks with .ics export: meeting_prep_focus_time.ics

claude_gutts.name: Actionable Recommendations & Reporting
claude_gutts.capability: Generate user-facing insights, summaries, and preparation guidance
claude_gutts.user_goal: Understand which meetings need prep and receive specific guidance
claude_gutts.evidence: Generated daily digest with prep alerts, schedule overview, specific recommendations: 'Executive Briefing on Oct 15 - 2 hours prep recommended'

gpt5_gutts.name: Retrieve Calendar Events
gpt5_gutts.capability: Access and fetch all scheduled meetings from the user's calendar
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure the system has the complete list of upcoming meetings
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Implementation calls to Google Calendar API or Microsoft Graph to pull event data

gpt5_gutts.name: Identify Important Meetings
gpt5_gutts.capability: Analyze fetched meetings and determine which ones are marked or inferred as important
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Distinguish important meetings from regular ones
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Priority tagging logic based on event metadata or user-defined rules

gpt5_gutts.name: Extract Meeting Context
gpt5_gutts.capability: Parse meeting details such as title, agenda, participants, and duration for context
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Gather contextual information needed for preparation assessment
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Parsing event descriptions and extracting agenda items from calendar entries

gpt5_gutts.name: Determine Preparation Requirement
gpt5_gutts.capability: Assess whether a meeting requires dedicated focus time based on its context and importance
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Identify meetings that need preparation before attending
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Model or rule engine that flags meetings with complex agendas or high-priority participants

gpt5_gutts.name: Flag Meetings Requiring Focus Time
gpt5_gutts.capability: Mark or annotate meetings that need preparation in the system
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Visually or programmatically indicate which meetings require preparation
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Adding a 'requires focus' tag or label to the calendar event

gpt5_gutts.name: Notify User of Preparation Needs
gpt5_gutts.capability: Send alerts or reminders to the user about meetings that require focus time
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure the user is aware of and can allocate time for preparation
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Push notification or email alert about flagged meetings

prompts.original_prompt: Help me understand where I am spending my time and identify ways I can reclaim time to focus more on my top priorities.

claude_gutts.name: Calendar Historical Data Retrieval
claude_gutts.capability: Load past calendar events for specified time period (weeks/months)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Get comprehensive time usage data for analysis
claude_gutts.evidence: Calendar API query for historical events in analysis period

claude_gutts.name: Meeting Categorization & Classification
claude_gutts.capability: Classify meetings by type, purpose, importance level, and participants
claude_gutts.user_goal: Understand what kinds of meetings fill the calendar
claude_gutts.evidence: Classification model applied to each historical meeting

claude_gutts.name: Time Aggregation & Statistical Analysis
claude_gutts.capability: Compute time spent per category, participant, project, and other dimensions
claude_gutts.user_goal: Quantify where time is actually going
claude_gutts.evidence: Aggregation queries computing total hours by various dimensions

claude_gutts.name: Priority Alignment Assessment
claude_gutts.capability: Evaluate which time usage aligns with stated priorities and identify gaps
claude_gutts.user_goal: See misalignment between goals and actual time usage
claude_gutts.evidence: Comparison of time allocation vs priority importance weights

claude_gutts.name: Low-Value Meeting Identification
claude_gutts.capability: Flag meetings that consume time without supporting priorities
claude_gutts.user_goal: Know which meetings to eliminate or delegate
claude_gutts.evidence: Identification of meetings with low priority alignment and high time cost

claude_gutts.name: Time Reclamation Opportunity Analysis
claude_gutts.capability: Calculate potential time savings from proposed changes (decline/delegate/shorten)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Understand how much time could be reclaimed
claude_gutts.evidence: Calculation of hours saved if low-value meetings are eliminated

claude_gutts.name: Schedule Optimization Recommendations
claude_gutts.capability: Suggest specific changes (decline, delegate, shorten, consolidate meetings)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Know exactly what to do to reclaim time
claude_gutts.evidence: Generated list of specific meeting changes with expected time savings

claude_gutts.name: Time Usage Reporting & Visualization
claude_gutts.capability: Present insights with charts, summaries, and comparisons (current vs optimal)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Easily understand patterns and take action
claude_gutts.evidence: Generated dashboard showing time distribution and reclamation opportunities

gpt5_gutts.name: Retrieve Calendar Events
gpt5_gutts.capability: Access and fetch all scheduled calendar events within the relevant timeframe
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Obtain a complete dataset of the user's time allocations
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Implementation calls Google/Microsoft Calendar API to pull event data

gpt5_gutts.name: Extract Event Attributes
gpt5_gutts.capability: Parse and normalize event details such as duration, participants, and category
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure all event data is structured for analysis
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Transforms raw calendar JSON into structured objects with standardized fields

gpt5_gutts.name: Classify Events by Category
gpt5_gutts.capability: Assign each event to a category (e.g., meeting, focus work, personal) using rules or ML
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Understand the nature of time spent across different activity types
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Uses ML model or keyword-based rules to label events as 'meeting', 'admin', etc.

gpt5_gutts.name: Identify Priority Alignment
gpt5_gutts.capability: Determine whether each event aligns with the user’s stated top priorities
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Evaluate which activities support the user’s goals
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Compares event descriptions against user-defined priority keywords or goals

gpt5_gutts.name: Compute Time Allocation Metrics
gpt5_gutts.capability: Aggregate event durations by category and priority alignment
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Quantify how time is distributed across different activities
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Generates summary metrics such as total hours in meetings vs. focus work

gpt5_gutts.name: Detect Low-Value or Non-Priority Blocks
gpt5_gutts.capability: Identify events that consume time but do not align with top priorities
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Spot reclaimable time opportunities
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Produces a list of events marked as low-priority or non-essential

gpt5_gutts.name: Generate Time Reclaim Recommendations
gpt5_gutts.capability: Suggest actionable strategies to free up time (e.g., decline, shorten, delegate)
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Receive practical steps to focus more on top priorities
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Outputs recommendations like 'Shorten weekly sync to 30 mins' or 'Decline optional meeting'

gpt5_gutts.name: Present Insights and Recommendations
gpt5_gutts.capability: Visualize time distribution and display suggested actions in an understandable format
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Clearly understand current time usage and next steps
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Generates charts and a summary dashboard with actionable insights

prompts.original_prompt: Starting next week, I want a weekly 30-min 1:1 with {name}. Afternoons preferred, avoid Fridays. Automatically reschedule on declines or conflicts.

claude_gutts.name: Constraint Extraction & Formalization
claude_gutts.capability: Parse scheduling requirements into structured constraints (weekly recurrence, duration, time preferences, exclusions)
claude_gutts.user_goal: System understands all scheduling rules and preferences
claude_gutts.evidence: Parsed constraints: weekly, 30min, afternoons, !Friday, auto-reschedule

claude_gutts.name: Multi-Calendar Availability Checking
claude_gutts.capability: Check free/busy status for both user and specified attendee
claude_gutts.user_goal: Find times when both parties are free
claude_gutts.evidence: API queries to retrieve availability for user and {name}

claude_gutts.name: Constraint-Based Slot Finding
claude_gutts.capability: Identify time slots matching all constraints (weekly pattern, afternoons, not Fridays, 30min duration)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Get valid time options that meet all preferences
claude_gutts.evidence: Algorithm finds afternoon slots excluding Fridays that fit 30min duration

claude_gutts.name: Recurring Meeting Series Creation
claude_gutts.capability: Create recurring calendar event with proper series configuration and recurrence rules
claude_gutts.user_goal: One-time setup creates ongoing weekly meetings automatically
claude_gutts.evidence: Created recurring event with RRULE:FREQ=WEEKLY

claude_gutts.name: Meeting Invitation Sending
claude_gutts.capability: Send calendar invitation to specified attendee with meeting details
claude_gutts.user_goal: Attendee receives invitation and can accept/decline
claude_gutts.evidence: Invitation sent to {name} with meeting details and RSVP request

claude_gutts.name: Decline/Conflict Detection & Monitoring
claude_gutts.capability: Monitor for attendee declines or new calendar conflicts in the series
claude_gutts.user_goal: System knows when rescheduling is needed
claude_gutts.evidence: Monitoring system tracks RSVP changes and conflict events

claude_gutts.name: Automatic Rescheduling Logic
claude_gutts.capability: When declined or conflicted, find new slot and send updated invitation automatically
claude_gutts.user_goal: Seamless rescheduling without manual intervention
claude_gutts.evidence: Automated workflow: detect decline → find new slot → send update

gpt5_gutts.name: Parse Scheduling Intent
gpt5_gutts.capability: Extract user intent and constraints from natural language input
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Convert user’s request into structured scheduling parameters
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Identify recurring meeting request, participant name, duration, start date, time preferences, and constraints

gpt5_gutts.name: Resolve Participant Identity
gpt5_gutts.capability: Match {name} to a specific contact or calendar entity
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure the correct person is invited to the meeting
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Map {name} to a unique email/contact in user’s directory

gpt5_gutts.name: Determine Recurrence Pattern
gpt5_gutts.capability: Translate 'weekly starting next week' into a structured recurrence rule
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Create a weekly recurring schedule starting from the correct date
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Generate RRULE for weekly 1:1 starting next Monday

gpt5_gutts.name: Apply Time Preferences
gpt5_gutts.capability: Interpret and enforce time-of-day and day-of-week constraints
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure meetings are scheduled in afternoons and not on Fridays
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Filter candidate slots to afternoons (e.g., 1–5 PM) and exclude Fridays

gpt5_gutts.name: Find Optimal Time Slot
gpt5_gutts.capability: Search calendars for available 30-minute slots matching constraints
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Identify a mutually available time that meets all preferences
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Locate first available afternoon slot next week excluding Friday

gpt5_gutts.name: Create Calendar Event
gpt5_gutts.capability: Generate and insert the meeting event into the calendar system
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Schedule the agreed-upon meeting in the calendar
gpt5_gutts.evidence: POST event with recurrence, participants, and time to calendar API

gpt5_gutts.name: Send Invitation
gpt5_gutts.capability: Dispatch meeting invite to participant(s)
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Notify participant and confirm meeting
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Send email/calendar invite to resolved participant

gpt5_gutts.name: Monitor for Declines or Conflicts
gpt5_gutts.capability: Track responses and detect scheduling conflicts post-creation
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Detect when rescheduling is needed
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Subscribe to event updates and participant responses

gpt5_gutts.name: Automatically Reschedule
gpt5_gutts.capability: Recompute and update meeting time when declines or conflicts occur
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Maintain recurring meeting without manual intervention
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Cancel original slot and book a new one following same constraints

prompts.original_prompt: Clear my Thursday afternoon. Update my RSVPs and help me reschedule my meetings to another time and show me as {status}.

claude_gutts.name: Time Block Specification Parsing
claude_gutts.capability: Interpret 'Thursday afternoon' into specific date and time range based on context
claude_gutts.user_goal: System knows exactly which time block to clear
claude_gutts.evidence: Resolved 'Thursday afternoon' to specific datetime range (e.g., Thu 1PM-5PM)

claude_gutts.name: Affected Meetings Identification
claude_gutts.capability: Find all meetings within the target time block that need rescheduling
claude_gutts.user_goal: Know which meetings need rescheduling
claude_gutts.evidence: Query identified N meetings in Thursday afternoon time block

claude_gutts.name: RSVP Decline Execution
claude_gutts.capability: Decline all meetings in the blocked time with appropriate notifications
claude_gutts.user_goal: Notify organizers user won't attend these instances
claude_gutts.evidence: RSVP status updated to 'declined' for all affected meetings

claude_gutts.name: Alternative Slot Finding
claude_gutts.capability: For each declined meeting, identify alternative time slots when same attendees are available
claude_gutts.user_goal: Find times when same attendees can meet
claude_gutts.evidence: Alternative slots identified for each meeting based on attendee availability

claude_gutts.name: Meeting Rescheduling Proposals
claude_gutts.capability: Send reschedule requests with proposed new times to meeting organizers/attendees
claude_gutts.user_goal: Meetings moved to new times with attendee agreement
claude_gutts.evidence: Reschedule proposals sent with alternative times for each meeting

claude_gutts.name: Calendar Status Update
claude_gutts.capability: Set user's availability/status for the blocked time (busy/away/focus time)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Others see user as unavailable during blocked time
claude_gutts.evidence: User status set to {status} for Thursday afternoon time block

claude_gutts.name: Focus Time Block Creation
claude_gutts.capability: Create placeholder calendar event for the blocked time with appropriate title/description
claude_gutts.user_goal: Visual representation of blocked time on calendar
claude_gutts.evidence: Focus time block event created for Thursday afternoon

claude_gutts.name: Action Summary & Confirmation
claude_gutts.capability: Report what was done (declined X meetings, rescheduled Y, blocked Z hours, set status)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Understand complete outcome of the request
claude_gutts.evidence: Summary report: 'Declined 3 meetings, proposed reschedules, blocked 4 hours, status set to {status}'

gpt5_gutts.name: Identify Thursday Afternoon Time Window
gpt5_gutts.capability: Parse and determine the exact time range for 'Thursday afternoon' based on user’s calendar settings and locale
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure the system understands which time slots need to be cleared
gpt5_gutts.evidence: System interprets 'Thursday afternoon' as 12:00 PM–5:00 PM local time

gpt5_gutts.name: Retrieve Thursday Afternoon Events
gpt5_gutts.capability: Fetch all calendar events scheduled within the identified Thursday afternoon time range
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Get a complete list of meetings that need to be cleared
gpt5_gutts.evidence: System queries calendar and lists 3 events between 1:00 PM and 4:30 PM

gpt5_gutts.name: Cancel or Decline Thursday Events
gpt5_gutts.capability: Update RSVPs for all identified events to indicate non-attendance (e.g., decline or cancel)
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure user is no longer committed to Thursday afternoon meetings
gpt5_gutts.evidence: System sends RSVP updates marking user as 'Declined' for all affected events

gpt5_gutts.name: Propose Alternative Times for Affected Meetings
gpt5_gutts.capability: Generate suitable alternative time slots for each rescheduled meeting based on user availability and constraints
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Find new times for meetings that were cleared from Thursday afternoon
gpt5_gutts.evidence: System suggests Friday 10:00 AM for one meeting and Monday 2:00 PM for another

gpt5_gutts.name: Reschedule Meetings to Proposed Times
gpt5_gutts.capability: Update calendar events with new times and send updated invites to participants
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure meetings are successfully moved to new time slots
gpt5_gutts.evidence: System updates event start time and sends revised invitations

gpt5_gutts.name: Update User Calendar Status for Thursday Afternoon
gpt5_gutts.capability: Set user’s calendar availability status (e.g., Free, Busy, Out of Office) for the cleared time window
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Reflect the desired status in the calendar for Thursday afternoon
gpt5_gutts.evidence: System marks Thursday afternoon as 'Free' in user’s calendar

prompts.original_prompt: Land a time to meet about Project Alpha with Chris, Sangya, and Kat for 1 hour in the next 2 weeks. Schedule over 1:1s and lunches if needed and work around Kat's schedule. Make the meeting in person and add a room.

claude_gutts.name: Meeting Requirements Extraction
claude_gutts.capability: Parse all requirements (attendees, duration, date range, override rules, modality, resources)
claude_gutts.user_goal: System understands all meeting parameters and constraints
claude_gutts.evidence: Extracted: 4 attendees, 1hr, 2-week window, override 1:1s/lunches, Kat priority, in-person, room needed

claude_gutts.name: Multi-Person Availability Aggregation
claude_gutts.capability: Check calendars for Chris, Sangya, Kat and merge availability data
claude_gutts.user_goal: Find times when all required attendees could be available
claude_gutts.evidence: Retrieved and merged calendar data for all 4 participants

claude_gutts.name: Priority Constraint Application (Kat's schedule)
claude_gutts.capability: Ensure primary consideration of Kat's availability as hard constraint
claude_gutts.user_goal: Kat's conflicts are absolute blockers, others can be overridden
claude_gutts.evidence: Kat's busy times marked as hard constraints in scheduling logic

claude_gutts.name: Override-Eligible Meeting Identification
claude_gutts.capability: Identify 1:1s and lunches on others' calendars that can be rescheduled if needed
claude_gutts.user_goal: System knows which existing meetings are movable
claude_gutts.evidence: Classified existing meetings as 1:1/lunch (override-eligible) or not

claude_gutts.name: Location-Based Filtering
claude_gutts.capability: Filter for in-person meeting capability (office presence, not remote-only days)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Meeting scheduled when in-person attendance is possible for all
claude_gutts.evidence: Filtered slots to days when all attendees are in office

claude_gutts.name: Conference Room Search & Booking
claude_gutts.capability: Find available conference room for in-person meeting and reserve it
claude_gutts.user_goal: Meeting has physical space reserved
claude_gutts.evidence: Room search for 4-person capacity, booking confirmation obtained

claude_gutts.name: Optimal Slot Selection
claude_gutts.capability: Rank and select best time considering all constraints (hard, soft, preferences)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Best possible time is chosen balancing all factors
claude_gutts.evidence: Ranked slots by: Kat availability, override cost, location, preferences

claude_gutts.name: Conflict Resolution & Rescheduling
claude_gutts.capability: If needed, reschedule override-eligible conflicts (1:1s/lunches) to make room
claude_gutts.user_goal: Conflicts automatically resolved to accommodate meeting
claude_gutts.evidence: Identified 1:1/lunch conflicts and initiated reschedule workflows

claude_gutts.name: Meeting Creation & Invitations
claude_gutts.capability: Create meeting with all attendees, room resource, and Project Alpha details
claude_gutts.user_goal: Meeting appears on all calendars with room reserved
claude_gutts.evidence: Event created with Chris, Sangya, Kat, room resource, 'Project Alpha' subject

gpt5_gutts.name: Parse Meeting Request
gpt5_gutts.capability: Extract meeting details such as participants, duration, timeframe, constraints, and preferences from natural language prompt
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Understand the full set of requirements for the requested meeting
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Prompt specifies participants (Chris, Sangya, Kat), duration (1 hour), timeframe (next 2 weeks), constraints (schedule over 1:1s and lunches if needed, work around Kat's schedule), and preferences (in person, add a room)

gpt5_gutts.name: Resolve Participant Identities
gpt5_gutts.capability: Map participant names to their corresponding calendar identities and contact information
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure the system knows exactly which calendars to check for availability
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Participants mentioned by first name only: Chris, Sangya, Kat

gpt5_gutts.name: Retrieve Participant Calendars
gpt5_gutts.capability: Access and retrieve availability data for all participants within the specified timeframe
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Obtain accurate availability windows for all required attendees
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Need to find a time in the next 2 weeks for Chris, Sangya, and Kat

gpt5_gutts.name: Retrieve Kat's Constraints
gpt5_gutts.capability: Identify and extract Kat-specific scheduling constraints and preferences from her calendar
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Respect Kat's schedule as a higher-priority constraint
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Prompt explicitly says 'work around Kat's schedule'

gpt5_gutts.name: Apply Override Rules
gpt5_gutts.capability: Determine which existing events (1:1s, lunches) can be overridden and under what conditions
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Allow rescheduling or overriding of lower-priority events to accommodate the new meeting
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Prompt states 'Schedule over 1:1s and lunches if needed'

gpt5_gutts.name: Compute Common Availability
gpt5_gutts.capability: Calculate overlapping free time slots for all participants within the given timeframe, respecting constraints and override rules
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Find a feasible 1-hour slot for all participants
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Meeting must include all three participants for 1 hour in the next 2 weeks

gpt5_gutts.name: Select Optimal Time Slot
gpt5_gutts.capability: Choose the best available time slot based on constraints, preferences, and minimal disruption
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Pick the most suitable time for everyone involved
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Must work around Kat's schedule and override 1:1s/lunches only if necessary

gpt5_gutts.name: Find Available Room
gpt5_gutts.capability: Locate and reserve an available physical meeting room matching the selected time slot
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure the meeting is in person with a reserved room
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Prompt specifies 'Make the meeting in person and add a room'

gpt5_gutts.name: Create and Send Meeting Invite
gpt5_gutts.capability: Generate the meeting event with all details and send invitations to participants
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Finalize the meeting and inform all attendees
gpt5_gutts.evidence: After selecting time and room, the meeting must be scheduled and participants notified

prompts.original_prompt: Help me set the agenda to review the progress of Project Alpha with the product and marketing team to get confirmation we are on track and discuss any blocking issues or risks.

claude_gutts.name: Meeting Context Retrieval
claude_gutts.capability: Gather information about Project Alpha from available sources (docs, project management tools, status reports)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Agenda based on actual project state, not generic template
claude_gutts.evidence: Retrieved Project Alpha documents, status updates, and current state information

claude_gutts.name: Stakeholder Role Identification
claude_gutts.capability: Understand product team vs marketing team roles, responsibilities, and concerns
claude_gutts.user_goal: Agenda addresses each group's specific needs and concerns
claude_gutts.evidence: Identified product team (delivery, features) vs marketing (messaging, launch) perspectives

claude_gutts.name: Agenda Structure Planning
claude_gutts.capability: Create logical flow for review meeting (progress → confirmation → blockers → risks)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Meeting has clear structure and logical progression
claude_gutts.evidence: Structured agenda: 1) Progress review, 2) On-track confirmation, 3) Blocker discussion, 4) Risk assessment

claude_gutts.name: Progress Review Items Generation
claude_gutts.capability: List specific accomplishments, milestones completed, and metrics to review
claude_gutts.user_goal: Concrete progress discussion points with evidence
claude_gutts.evidence: Generated list of completed milestones, metrics (e.g., feature completion %), achievements

claude_gutts.name: Blocker & Risk Identification
claude_gutts.capability: Surface known issues, dependencies, blockers, and potential risks for discussion
claude_gutts.user_goal: Problems addressed proactively in meeting
claude_gutts.evidence: Identified current blockers (e.g., API dependency) and risks (e.g., timeline pressure)

claude_gutts.name: Time Allocation & Formatting
claude_gutts.capability: Assign time to each agenda item and format for professional distribution
claude_gutts.user_goal: Professional, well-structured agenda document ready to share
claude_gutts.evidence: Time allocated per section (15min progress, 10min confirmation, 20min blockers, 15min risks), formatted document

gpt5_gutts.name: Extract Meeting Intent
gpt5_gutts.capability: Identify that the user wants to create an agenda for a progress review meeting
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure the system understands the purpose of the request
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Detects 'set the agenda' and 'review the progress of Project Alpha' as core intent

gpt5_gutts.name: Identify Project Context
gpt5_gutts.capability: Extract and confirm the project name and context from the prompt
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Associate the agenda with Project Alpha accurately
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Recognizes 'Project Alpha' as the specific project under discussion

gpt5_gutts.name: Determine Participants
gpt5_gutts.capability: Identify required participants (product and marketing team) from the request
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure correct stakeholders are considered for the meeting
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Extracts 'product team' and 'marketing team' as participant groups

gpt5_gutts.name: Retrieve Team Member Details
gpt5_gutts.capability: Map identified teams to actual user contacts or calendar groups
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Translate team names into actionable participant lists
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Queries organizational directory to find members of product and marketing teams

gpt5_gutts.name: Define Agenda Objectives
gpt5_gutts.capability: Extract and structure the meeting objectives from the user prompt
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure agenda reflects all user-stated goals
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Identifies objectives: review progress, confirm on-track status, discuss blocking issues/risks

gpt5_gutts.name: Generate Agenda Items
gpt5_gutts.capability: Convert objectives into actionable agenda items in logical order
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Provide a clear, organized agenda for the meeting
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Creates items: 1) Progress review, 2) On-track confirmation, 3) Blocking issues and risks

gpt5_gutts.name: Validate Agenda Completeness
gpt5_gutts.capability: Check that all user-specified topics are included and no critical element is missing
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure the agenda fully meets the stated purpose
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Compares generated agenda items against extracted objectives

gpt5_gutts.name: Present Agenda for Confirmation
gpt5_gutts.capability: Display the proposed agenda to the user for approval or edits
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Allow user to confirm or adjust the agenda before finalization
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Shows draft agenda in user interface with edit/approve options

prompts.original_prompt: Review the materials for my meeting with senior leadership and suggest the best way to summarize the topics into three main discussion points. Generate any objections or concerns that might come up and give me effective responses.

claude_gutts.name: Meeting Materials Retrieval
claude_gutts.capability: Access and load all relevant documents, presentations, and data for the meeting
claude_gutts.user_goal: System has all materials to analyze comprehensively
claude_gutts.evidence: Retrieved meeting materials (presentations, reports, data files)

claude_gutts.name: Content Analysis & Topic Extraction
claude_gutts.capability: Identify main themes and topics across all materials
claude_gutts.user_goal: Understand what the materials cover at high level
claude_gutts.evidence: Extracted key themes from materials using NLP analysis

claude_gutts.name: Executive Summary Distillation
claude_gutts.capability: Condense complex topics into 3 concise, high-impact discussion points
claude_gutts.user_goal: Clear, high-level discussion framework for leadership
claude_gutts.evidence: Generated 3 discussion points: 1) Strategy alignment, 2) Resource needs, 3) Risk mitigation

claude_gutts.name: Audience-Aware Framing
claude_gutts.capability: Frame discussion points appropriately for senior leadership audience (strategic, high-level, business impact)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Points resonate with executive priorities and concerns
claude_gutts.evidence: Framed points with business impact, strategic implications, resource considerations

claude_gutts.name: Objection Anticipation
claude_gutts.capability: Predict concerns, pushback, or tough questions from senior leaders
claude_gutts.user_goal: Prepared for tough questions and challenges
claude_gutts.evidence: Anticipated objections: budget concerns, timeline feasibility, ROI questions

claude_gutts.name: Response Preparation
claude_gutts.capability: Generate effective, well-reasoned responses to anticipated objections
claude_gutts.user_goal: Confident, well-reasoned responses ready for each concern
claude_gutts.evidence: Prepared responses with supporting data, analogies, mitigation strategies

claude_gutts.name: Briefing Document Generation
claude_gutts.capability: Format summary, objections, and responses into comprehensive prep document
claude_gutts.user_goal: Comprehensive prep materials ready to review before meeting
claude_gutts.evidence: Generated briefing doc: 3 discussion points, anticipated objections, prepared responses

gpt5_gutts.name: Retrieve Meeting Materials
gpt5_gutts.capability: Access and collect all relevant documents and resources for the specified senior leadership meeting
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Ensure all necessary materials for the meeting are available for review
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Fetch files linked to the meeting invite and associated shared folders

gpt5_gutts.name: Analyze Meeting Materials
gpt5_gutts.capability: Read and extract key information, topics, and themes from the retrieved documents
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Understand the content and identify main subjects in the meeting materials
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Perform semantic analysis to identify recurring concepts and critical points

gpt5_gutts.name: Generate Candidate Discussion Topics
gpt5_gutts.capability: List all significant topics identified from the analysis for potential discussion
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Have a comprehensive set of possible discussion items derived from the materials
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Produce a preliminary list of 8-12 key topics extracted from the documents

gpt5_gutts.name: Rank and Select Top Three Topics
gpt5_gutts.capability: Prioritize and choose the three most important discussion points based on relevance and impact
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Identify the three most strategic topics for senior leadership discussion
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Apply weighted scoring to select top three topics from candidate list

gpt5_gutts.name: Generate Potential Objections
gpt5_gutts.capability: Predict likely objections or concerns that senior leadership might raise regarding the selected topics
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Prepare for possible pushback or questions during the meeting
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Produce a list of 2-3 plausible objections per discussion point

gpt5_gutts.name: Create Effective Responses
gpt5_gutts.capability: Formulate clear, persuasive responses to each predicted objection
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Be equipped with strong, ready-to-use answers to anticipated concerns
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Generate concise, actionable responses aligned with meeting objectives

prompts.original_prompt: Prepare a brief for my upcoming meeting with customer Beta and include a dossier for each customer attendee and the topics they are most interested in. Include a background on their company.

claude_gutts.name: Meeting Details Retrieval
claude_gutts.capability: Get meeting information (attendees list, meeting time, purpose/subject)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Know who's attending, when, and meeting context
claude_gutts.evidence: Retrieved meeting details: attendees from customer Beta, subject, date/time

claude_gutts.name: Company Background Research
claude_gutts.capability: Gather information about customer Beta company (industry, size, products, recent news)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Understand customer's business context and current state
claude_gutts.evidence: Compiled company background: industry, revenue, key products, recent developments

claude_gutts.name: Attendee Identity Resolution
claude_gutts.capability: Identify each customer attendee and their specific roles/titles
claude_gutts.user_goal: Know exactly who you're meeting with and their positions
claude_gutts.evidence: Resolved attendees: John Smith (VP Product), Sarah Chen (Director Engineering)

claude_gutts.name: Individual Dossier Creation
claude_gutts.capability: For each attendee, compile background, role, interaction history, and context
claude_gutts.user_goal: Personalized context for each individual attendee
claude_gutts.evidence: Created dossiers with background, role, past interactions, preferences

claude_gutts.name: Topic Interest Analysis
claude_gutts.capability: Identify topics each attendee cares about based on communication history, role, and context
claude_gutts.user_goal: Discuss what matters most to each person
claude_gutts.evidence: VP Product: roadmap integration; Director Eng: API performance, scalability

claude_gutts.name: Relationship History Compilation
claude_gutts.capability: Summarize past interactions, deals, support issues, and relationship context with customer
claude_gutts.user_goal: Aware of relationship history and ongoing context
claude_gutts.evidence: History: signed contract Q2, 3 support escalations, renewal upcoming Q4

claude_gutts.name: Relevant Content Gathering
claude_gutts.capability: Find related materials (proposals, presentations, technical docs, case studies)
claude_gutts.user_goal: Have supporting materials ready for discussion
claude_gutts.evidence: Gathered: recent proposal, technical integration guide, relevant case study

claude_gutts.name: Brief Document Assembly
claude_gutts.capability: Compile all information into structured, comprehensive prep brief
claude_gutts.user_goal: Complete brief ready for meeting preparation
claude_gutts.evidence: Generated brief: company background, attendee dossiers, topics, history, materials

gpt5_gutts.name: Identify Upcoming Meeting with Customer Beta
gpt5_gutts.capability: Locate the specific upcoming calendar event involving customer Beta
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Find the correct meeting to prepare for
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Query calendar events and match 'customer Beta' in participant or title fields

gpt5_gutts.name: Extract Meeting Details
gpt5_gutts.capability: Retrieve date, time, and participant list from the identified meeting
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Obtain meeting metadata for context and attendee identification
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Parse event object for start time, end time, and attendees

gpt5_gutts.name: Identify Customer Attendees
gpt5_gutts.capability: Filter attendees belonging to customer Beta from the participant list
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Determine which attendees represent the customer
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Cross-reference attendee emails/domains with Beta's domain

gpt5_gutts.name: Retrieve Profile Data for Each Customer Attendee
gpt5_gutts.capability: Fetch professional background and role information for each identified attendee
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Gather attendee-specific details for the dossier
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Call CRM or LinkedIn API to get role, title, and bio

gpt5_gutts.name: Determine Topics of Interest for Each Attendee
gpt5_gutts.capability: Analyze historical interactions or preference data to identify topics each attendee cares about
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Personalize the briefing by including relevant topics
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Aggregate prior meeting notes or CRM tags to extract interest areas

gpt5_gutts.name: Compile Dossier for Each Customer Attendee
gpt5_gutts.capability: Generate a structured summary containing attendee background and topics of interest
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Create an attendee-specific dossier for the briefing
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Assemble profile details and interest topics into a formatted section

gpt5_gutts.name: Retrieve Company Background for Customer Beta
gpt5_gutts.capability: Gather company-level information such as industry, size, recent news
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Provide context about the customer's organization
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Query company database or external sources for Beta's profile

gpt5_gutts.name: Compose Meeting Brief
gpt5_gutts.capability: Integrate meeting details, attendee dossiers, and company background into a concise briefing document
gpt5_gutts.user_goal: Deliver a complete, well-structured meeting preparation brief
gpt5_gutts.evidence: Generate final document with sections for meeting info, attendee dossiers, and company overview
